candidates.title: Bump tabled from 0.3.0 to 0.4.2
candidates.body:
Bumps [tabled](https://github.com/zhiburt/tabled) from 0.3.0 to 0.4.2.
Changelog

Sourced from tabled's changelog.

[0.4.2] - 2021-12-30

Added

  • Builder structure for dynamic creation of table

Fixed

  • It turns out that in version [0.4.0] tabled_derive was inproperly bumped version. So it broke version [0.3]. To fix it it was necessary to yank versions [0.4.0] and [0.4.1] and yank tabled_derive [0.1.9]. It was pointed out by @​Disasm.

[0.4.0] - 2021-12-30

Added

  • Style constants like Style::ASCII, Style::PSEUDO,
  • Highlight modificator which does highlight of any combination of cells
  • TableIteratorExt trait by @​24seconds
  • Concat modificator by @​senk8
  • A Table::shape method which returns table's size

Changed

  • Tabled trait now requires a LENGTH constant.
  • Style functions were deprecated.
  • Allow border changes for any cell.

Fixed

  • Fix fmt::Display requirments on hidden fields in inline mode
  • README.md fix by @​panarch
  • Refactorings
Commits
  • 70e27d9 tabled/ Bump version to 0.4.2
  • 0bac6c0 tabled/ Use table_derive 0.2.0
  • 76d4138 tabled/ Bump version to 0.4.1
  • 8bac1f4 tabled/ Use tabled_derive version 0.2.0
  • 9cd93bd tabled_derive/ Bump version to 2.0
  • 67c7e5f tabled/ Move Table structure to its own file
  • de15392 Merge pull request #47 from zhiburt/from_data
  • a3951bd tabled/ Rename header function to set header
  • 912722f tabled/ Fix cargo fmt
  • 8298af5 tabled/ Update Builder doc comment
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Bump tracing-subscriber from 0.3.4 to 0.3.5
candidates.body:
Bumps [tracing-subscriber](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tracing) from 0.3.4 to 0.3.5.
Release notes

Sourced from tracing-subscriber's releases.

tracing-subscriber 0.3.5

This release re-enables RUST_LOG filtering in tracing_subscriber::fmt's default initialization methods, and adds an OffsetLocalTime formatter for using local timestamps with the time crate.

Added

  • fmt: Added OffsetLocalTime formatter to fmt::time for formatting local timestamps with a fixed offset (#1772)

Fixed

  • fmt: Added a Targets filter to fmt::init() and fmt::try_init() when the "env-filter" feature is disabled, so that RUST_LOG is still honored (#1781)

Thanks to @​marienz and @​ishitatsuyuki for contributing to this release!

#1772: tokio-rs/tracing#1772 #1781: tokio-rs/tracing#1781

  • 46a3d96 chore: deny warnings in docs builds

candidates.title: Bump pulldown-cmark from 0.8.0 to 0.9.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [pulldown-cmark](https://github.com/raphlinus/pulldown-cmark) from 0.8.0 to 0.9.0.
Release notes

Sourced from pulldown-cmark's releases.

0.9.0

This release brings a number of changes.

New features

  • Thanks to @​lo48576, pulldown now optionally supports custom header ids and classes for headers. Set ENABLE_HEADING_ATTRIBUTES in the options to enable.
  • Users can now access reference definitions, information that was previously only exposed internally.
  • Pulldown is now CommonMark 0.30 compliant.

Changes

  • The function signature for the broken link callback has changed slightly to allow for FnMut functions.

There have also been a number of (small) parsing bug fixes.

Commits
  • 967dd38 Bump MSRV
  • 6ccec87 Update dependencies; update specs; bump version to 0.9.0
  • 47fbbc1 Generate tests in azure build to make sure they are up-to-date
  • d602ad4 Update test suite to reflect recent behavior change
  • b7d69a8 Fix some list interrupting paragraph incorrectness
  • 9afb255 Use inline CSS for table cell text alignment
  • e6c0577 Add tests for heading attribute blocks as a spec document
  • 2a051de Implement parsing and conversion for heading attribute blocks
  • 0e08bad Add fields for an ID fragment and classes to headings
  • 33b1d85 Sort auto-generated tests modules by spec names
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Use tokenizer for extraction; add benchmark
candidates.body:
This avoids creating a DOM tree for link extraction and instead uses a `TokenSink` for on-the-fly extraction.
In my hyperfine benchmarks it was about 10-25% faster than the `master`.

Old: `4.557 s ±  0.404 s`
New: `3.832 s ±  0.131 s`

The performance fluctuates a little less as well.

I also added a few more element/attribute pairs which contain links according to the HTML spec. These occur very rarely, but it's good to parse them for completeness' sake.

Furthermore tried to clean up a lot of papercuts around our types. We now differentiate between a `RawUri` (stringy-types) and a `Uri`, which is a properly parsed URI type. 
The extractor now only deals with extracting `RawUri`s while the collector creates the request objects.

If someone wants to look into the code, I'd be happy for a review.
(I'll squash the commits before I merge of course. ^^)

candidates.body:

Release notes

Sourced from anyhow's releases.

1.0.48

  • Include a Debug rendering of lhs and rhs in ensure! messages (#193, #194, #195, #196, #197, #198)

    Example:

    ensure!(flags.len() <= 40);

    ensure!(kind == Kind::File);

    Before:

    Condition failed: `flags.len() <= 40`
Condition failed: `kind == Kind::File`

    After:

    Condition failed: `flags.len() <= 40` (99 vs 40)
Condition failed: `kind == Kind::File` (Symlink vs File)

candidates.title: Colorize and simplify status output
candidates.body: I got a bit annoyed by the current status output. ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lycheeverse/lychee/master/assets/lychee.gif) While it sort of works, it's not too nice to look at and a little annoying to read and understand. So I reworked it with a human user in mind. The terminal output should not be parsed by machines; that's what we have the JSON output for. That said, we might introduce a third output in the future that is closer to the old output which allows for easier grepping. The new summary is more compact: The error output also got a revamp and is closer to the the output of [ripgrep](https://github.com/BurntSushi/ripgrep) now: Let me know what you think. Also a code review would be great. 😊

candidates.title: Improve concurrency with streams
candidates.body:
The goal of this effort is to avoid blocking the runtime as much as possible.
This is a multi-step approach:

* [x] Change `input::get_contents` from returning`Vec<InputContent>` to `Stream<Item=Result<InputContent>>`.
* [x] Change `Collector::collect_links` from returning `Result<HashSet<Request>>` to `Stream<Item=Result<InputContent>>`. (1)
* [x] Remove deadpool from the dependencies in lychee-lib and only work with streams throughout the call-stack.
   https://github.com/lycheeverse/lychee/pull/355
* [x] ~Remove `ClientPool` as reqwest already has a built-in pool.~
* [x] Simplify `main.rs` by removing mpsc channels and iterating over streams directly.
* [x] ~Optional: Move the link cache out of the collector. Use a [XOR filter](https://github.com/ayazhafiz/xorf) instead of a HashSet. It uses less memory.~

See #193, https://github.com/lycheeverse/lychee/issues/21#issuecomment-913877831

@TimoFreiberg fyi

chosen_pr.title: Bump tokio from 1.14.0 to 1.15.0
chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.14.0 to 1.15.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.15.0

Fixed

  • io: add cooperative yielding support to io::empty() (#4300)
  • time: make timeout robust against budget-depleting tasks (#4314)

Changed

  • update minimum supported Rust version to 1.46.

Added

  • time: add Interval::reset() (#4248)
  • io: add explicit lifetimes to AsyncFdReadyGuard (#4267)
  • process: add Command::as_std() (#4295)

Added (unstable)

  • tracing: instrument tokio::sync types (#4302)

#4302: tokio-rs/tokio#4302 #4300: tokio-rs/tokio#4300 #4295: tokio-rs/tokio#4295 #4267: tokio-rs/tokio#4267 #4248: tokio-rs/tokio#4248 #4314: tokio-rs/tokio#4314

Commits
  • f646735 chore: prepare Tokio v1.15.0 release (#4320)
  • 54e6693 time: make timeout robust against budget-depleting tasks (#4314)
